content:
What a great idea! Describing your Sundays as a dedicated writing day is a wonderful way to start your memoir. Capturing the atmosphere and emotions of your writing routine will help readers connect with your experience and understand the significance of writing in your life.

Here's a possible way to start your chapter:

**Sunday Mornings**

Sunday mornings are my favorite time of the week. The world outside is still quiet, the sun is slowly rising, and the air is filled with a sense of possibility. I wake up early, feeling a mix of excitement and anticipation. Today is my writing day.

As I shuffle to the kitchen to brew a cup of coffee, the aroma of freshly ground beans fills the air, and I feel my senses come alive. The ritual of making coffee is a comforting one, a signal that it's time to settle in and focus on my craft. I pour the steaming hot liquid into my favorite mug, feeling the warmth spread through my hands as I hold it.

With my coffee in hand, I make my way to my desk, a sacred space that's become my sanctuary. The blank page stares back at me, a tabula rasa waiting to be filled with words, stories, and emotions. I take a deep breath, feeling a sense of calm wash over me. This is my happy place, where I can escape the chaos of everyday life and tap into my creativity.

As I sit down, I feel a sense of excitement building inside me. What will I write today? Will it be a short story, a poem, or a chapter in my novel? The possibilities are endless, and the thrill of discovery is what drives me forward.

For the next few hours, I'll be lost in my own little world, where words flow freely, and my imagination knows no bounds. This is my therapy, my escape, my passion. This is what makes me feel alive.

Feel free to modify this to fit your own voice and style, but hopefully, this gives you a good starting point. Remember to focus on the sensory details, emotions, and sensations that make your writing experience unique and special. Good luck, and have fun!
